title: Reduce data and ads

Causing Wi-Fi to not auto-reconnect on CM12.1
ghnta kti h bekar h

Edit: If some apps are are blocked by Wifi but LAN is allowed, they will still work within the LAN, but some Apps will need both Wifi and LAN to be allowed in order for them to work on LAN. I found this to be very weird and cannot figure out why this is the case. One such App is Unified Remote. Wake On LAN will not work if Wifi is blocked but LAN is allowed. No independent TCP/UDP Controls. Over all it is a great Firewall, but only really useful when you have an app that should not require ANY network activity -  But you will need alternative means to protect yourself from potentially malicious apps. Thanks for this app.

title: Does as advertised, highly recommended
comment: I've tried several firewall apps, and I work in networking so after making change via this app, I also check configs (internal firewall rules  and IPTABLES) to see if it works correctly.   I can only say this app is really great (I am still checking stuff)  it's rare indeed  an ANDROID app  does what is says, especially a free one, my hats off to the developer. This app seems  quite flexible, has options if you use wifi-tethering for DHCP/DNS, all the various  system process, half of which I have no idea what they do. I am normally not so anal, but to me Android devices (mine is a galaxy10.1 2014 customROM/rooted/modified)  really need firewalls. I notice almost every stock/downloaded app seems to  secretly connects back to some server.  I imagine most the time these are harmless, but who has the time to check all that ? so really I  don't know.    I do know that's  traffic I don't want, don't need, and this app is great, especially since  Android's strategy is design and obfuscate to do their bidding IMHO.    So be it, thanks again  this Developer deserves a standing ovation (all I can do is 5-starts my first 5-start rating ever after 3 years...)

title: An app uses sound streaming to bypasses fw.
comment: I have an app that can stream sound  (play sounds) even though it is blocked. It cannot download when blocked but can play sound by streaming. I think it is using 'Media server' which is a Core app. If Media server is blocked then it cannot stream even if it's not blocked. This happens using WiFi or 4G. When an app is blocked then it should also be blocked from streaming. Rooted Note 3 stock rom jb4.3
Thanks for your suggestion. I've added keywords in the description, hope to get more attention.If not I'll think about changing the name :)

title: This wall leaks
comment: I'm done with this software.  It has leaked data on me so many times, I've actually lost count.  A few times I switched back to DroidWall, only to come back and to give a newer version of AFWall+ another chance.  Every single time, I regretted it.  The same thing has happened every time, I catch AFWall+ leaking, allowing internet access to programs that were blocked.  With the last update now, the firewall periodically just fails and turns itself off on my Samsung S5.  This is a piece of garbage, avoid it if you value your security.

Thanks for your feedback. AFWall+ works based on iptables and designed to work with existing iptables used by Android or any other apps using iptables and historically samsung devices doesn't have proper iptables support ( most of them doesn't have default iptables chains)
Thanks.

title: BILAL YOUNAS JUTT
comment: ***ROOT REQUIRED*** If you don't know what root is, please search for "How to root android" in the Internet. AFWall+ (Android Firewall +) is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall.It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your data networks (2G/3G and/or Wi-Fi and while in roaming). Also you can control traffic within LAN or while connected through VPN.

title: Coupled with XPrivacy.... Total Control!
comment: GS4, 4.3, Stock(ish) v6 ROM, KT kernel -  XPrivacy + AFWall gives ME total control of all permissions & data. XPrivacy denies or spoofs info requests via perm's (contacts, device Id, etc) & apps that FC when I try to deny web access via XPrivacy, I just grant access in XPrivacy to allow app to run then use AFWall to shut down app's access to web. Awesome combo to keep Big Brother, NSA, nosy devs, pesky ads & data miners at bay. Nothing to hide but my privacy is MINE! Thanks UKPRIYA!

It's a false report. iptables works are kernel level and Android reports data at one level above. If you configure AFWall+ properly, it will not leak any data. Thanks.

comment: Right off the bat this app's interface is confusing, as by default it's on "white list mode" which according to the app means that ONLY selected apps are allowed internet access, when in fact it's the opposite - EVERYTHING BUT selected apps are allowed internet access. Sometimes it gets disabled by itself!! Few apps are getting restricted from internet even they are allowed! Droidwall worked well without any flaw. Fix the issues. Till then Bye, uninstalling.

Instead of leaving bad rating , please use the same time to report the issue to developer to help him to fix the issue. We work hard to fix the issues and these comments really encourage us even more.
